content: with ws purl-side facing you with yarn bc beginning at hedghog s working on one hind leg at a time ws facing fold the cast-off edge at right hind leg back marker pick up 5 sts purlwise across belly row foot in half mattress stitch to join cast off edge for the bottom of the ends from right hind leg back marker to right hind leg front marker foot then mattress stitch to join the row ends from base of foot up to hind leg back marker for leg back seam row 1 increase cast on 5 sts k10 10sts join top of hind leg row 2 p2tog p2 pfb twice p2 p2tog working on one hind leg at a time match the hind leg front marker row 3 knit with the upper hind leg front marker from side and leg back seam row 4-5 repeat last 2 row once with upper hind leg back marker from belly mattress stitch from hind leg front marker to upper hind leg back marker so joining the top of cut yarn b join yarn a to work with yarn ac as follows the hind leg cast-on edge to cast-off edge from side see fig 8 work short row to shape the foot short row 1 p7 w+t mattress stitch to join the seam that runs down the back side from the rear centre marker to the cast-off edges short row 2 k4 w+t stuff the hedgehog -well into the back very very lightly into the belly and short row 3 p3 w+t face short row 4 k2 w+t ease then mattress stitch the cast-off edge from belly rear end to the few short row 5 purl to end row ends either side of the back side cast off for bottom of right foot remove all remaining markers place a little spare yarn in the base of the foot and then flatten the base with your fingers to create a nice foot shape for all four feet with yarn a yarn f for white hedgehog sew four straight stitches over the foot for the claws to see more patterns and details on how to receive a free knitting pattern every other month follow along with @dotpebbles_knits on instagram and #imadethisrabbit page on facebook
